French PM ready to compromise on deficit reduction target
subhead: Sébastien Lecornu suggested he is willing to reduce the public deficit by half as much as what his predecessor had planned for 2026, if it helps secure a compromise to pass the bill.

title: Gisèle Pelicot says she 'never' gave consent to accused rapist at appeal trial
subhead: 'Take responsibility for your actions and stop hiding behind your cowardice,' Pelicot told Husamettin Dogan, the only man to have appealed his conviction of raping her while she was unconscious.

title: Morocco's youth spotlight Agadir hospital as emblem of healthcare collapse
subhead: At the heart of protests following the death in August of eight women after failed c-sections, the Hassan-II facility embodies all the weaknesses of Morocco's two-tier healthcare system.

title: 'In Gaza, death is everywhere,' says head of Doctors Without Borders
subhead: After spending a week in the Palestianian enclave, Claire Magone, the director of the NGO, fears that Donald Trump's ceasefire plan won't stop the territory's destruction.

title: Michel Devoret, 2025 Physics Nobel laureate: 'I thought it was a prank. The quantum computer is not here yet'
subhead: Physicist Michel Devoret reflects on the skepticism that surrounded the early days of research on macroscopic quantum tunneling. This phenomenon earned him the Nobel Prize on Tuesday, alongside two collaborators.

title: The double life of Jared Kushner, mixing business with politics as emissary for his father-in-law Donald Trump
subhead: Ivanka Trump's husband has a career as an unofficial diplomat and a master dealmaker, juggling billions and focusing his activities on the Middle East and Near East. His latest big coup, carried out with the Saudi sovereign wealth fund, was the $55 billion acquisition of video game giant Electronic Arts.

title: Israeli kibbutzim ravaged by October 7 attacks rebuild while honoring the past
subhead: Be'eri, Kfar Aza and Nir Oz were the communities hit the hardest by the attack carried out by Hamas two years ago. Since then, each has tried to reinvent itself, in its own way and at its own pace.
